framed.omics package¶

Submodules¶

framed.omics.dataset module¶

This module implements methods for handling multi-omics datasets.

Author: Daniel Machado

class framed.omics.dataset.DataSet(jsonfile)¶

Represents a multi-omics dataset for multiple experimental conditions.

The dataset must be loaded from a json file with an acceptable format (see examples).

Mandatory fields include:
  • conditions
  • carbon source
  • mode (aerobic/anaerobic)
  • gene deletions (if any)
  • measured growth rate
Optionally these omics data may be available:
  • transcriptomics
  • proteomics
  • fluxomics
  • metabolomics

framed.omics.simulation module¶

This module implements omics-based simulation methods.

Author: Daniel Machado

framed.omics.simulation.GIMME(model, gene_exp, cutoff=25, growth_frac=0.9, constraints=None, parsimonious=False)¶

Run a GIMME simulation (Becker and Palsson, 2008).

Parameters:
  • model (CBModel) – model
  • gene_exp (dict) – transcriptomics data
  • cutoff (int) – percentile cuttof (default: 25)
  • growth_frac (float) – minimum growth requirement (default: 0.9)
  • constraints (dict) – additional constraints
  • parsimonious (bool) – compute a parsimonious solution (default: False)
Returns:

solution
Return type:

Solution
framed.omics.simulation.eFlux(model, gene_exp, scale_rxn=None, scale_value=None, constraints=None, parsimonious=False)¶

Run an E-Flux simulation (Colijn et al, 2009).

Parameters:
  • model (CBModel) – model
  • gene_exp (dict) – transcriptomics data
  • scale_rxn (str) – reaction to scale flux vector (optional)
  • scale_value (float) – scaling factor (mandatory if scale_rxn is specified)
  • constraints (dict) – additional constraints (optional)
  • parsimonious (bool) – compute a parsimonious solution (default: False)
Returns:

solution
Return type:

Solution

framed.omics.simulation.gene_to_reaction_expression(model, gene_exp, and_func=<built-in function min>, or_func=<built-in function sum>)¶

Module contents¶

Author: Daniel Machado
